snippet: More people are shedding a long-nurtured reluctance to challenge the city-state’s paternalistic leaders and their “autocratic light” style of governance.
abstract: More people, partly propelled by social media, are shedding their reluctance to challenge Singapore's paternalistic leaders and their style of governance, which borders on autocratic; many of the most vocal activists are young, wired and cynical about the government’s argument that it alone can maintain the prosperity and social harmony that has transformed this resource-starved island into one of the most advanced economies.

byline.contributor: Jacob Fromer contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: More people are shedding a long-nurtured reluctance to challenge the city-state’s paternalistic leaders and their “autocratic light” style of governance.

headline.seo: Activism Grows as Singapore Loosens Restrictions
headline.main: As Singapore Loosens Its Grip, Residents Lose Fear to Challenge Authority
headline.print_headline: As Singapore Loosens Its Grip, Residents Lose Fear to Challenge Authority
